intro: Pilosella acutifolia subsp. deggenavica, commonly known as the acuteleaf goatweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and grasslands. It has slender, hairy stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters. The subspecies is distinguished by its acute leaf tips and slightly different morphological features compared to other Pilosella species.
